page.title: 10FARM SHOP
page.content: Rochester Farm handles 7000 turkeys a year of a breed called Sun Valley Two. The farm covers 82 acres,2 for the turkeys.They are fed until fat enough to be slaughtered by electric shock. They are then hung and then plucked.The average weight of a turkey is 15 lbs but they vary between 7-45 lbs. The owner sells most of them at his shop in Great Leighs.If his stock is damaged in any way he sells them as turkey burgers or cutlets. They sell on average about 20 turkeys a week,but at Christmas time he sells between 6000-7000,since eating a turkey at christmas is customary.
